title: My thoughts on the recent /Dev Diary: League Comics and Marvel
body:
In all my years of playing League of Legends, this is the first time I’m posting something as I feel this is an important topic for me. Firstly one of the main reasons I still play League is because of its lore, I love discovering more stuff about the universe of League, Runeterra and my favourite champions. That said, I’m concerned/disappointed due to the following reasons:

•	Why not use different art styles? I enjoy experiencing stories in different art styles as well as mediums. It keeps things interesting and can change in accordance with the feel/message u want to deliver to the audience.

•	I’m glad u found a partner, but please do not aspire to be like them. U have your own style and universe that u have built from the ground up, and u have done a great job so far. I would like to see u keep evolving your own style instead of just copying the way Marvel has done things. I feel Riot’s art, lore and music departments/teams are amazing and do not always get the credit they deserve. So please, do your own thing.

•	My main disappointment: Available for free only after **6 months after release???** One of the best feelings is getting home and knowing there is a new story about League waiting to be read. It’s something I look forward to and enjoy up until the moment I finish the new story. Why not shorten the period to two months? Why not make it a week or two? I’m sure u would still make a lot of money irrespective of whether the waiting period is 6 months, one or two months, or one or two weeks. The idea of being left out of the loop for 6 months because I can’t afford to buy new pieces of League lore (I live in a 3rd world country with a weak exchange rate) just because I have to buy something that previously was for free… it really saddens me. So please do not take away or delay one of the best things about League of Legends for people like me; it won’t be nice to be left out of the loop for that amount of time.


This is just my opinion as someone who loves League and its universe.

replies.body:
To ur last point. I think there are other posts which does this better, but here goes.   

 The goal for riot with the comics are: to be self sustaining (ie pay for themselves);  not just a promotion for the game but its own enjoyable product;  and for us to be good partner with marvel. 

 This means we need to pay our overhead (including part of my salary!) and marvel needs to make a profit.   Marvel and comicology have standard practices in this sphere for very solid reasons — globally comics are actually a niche industry.  So while we are learning: how many of our potential fans are interested in this material; what percentage will buy the trade deluxe edition, if its going to appeal to non-league players etc...  etc...  We and marvel are moving forward conservatively.  

  I can assure you:  1. riot will be putting out more free lore and stories than youve seen from us in a looong time, 2. we want all fans to be able to read these and 3 we are already hoping we  that the audience base will large enough to will allow us to bring prices or release times down.   

BUT this is a new venture for us— and honestly something we’ve seen most other gaming companies fail at.

This first year you will get all the comics for free online before we release any trade paperbacks.  

We really, really believe your gonna like these.   And we are really, really hoping you and other fans will prosthelytize how much u love them to non-players, non-comic readers etc... so we (and marvel) can continue making these and have more release options the following years.

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

Though I won't use the word "charity" (since the writers are still being paid by Riot), I do think monetary compensation in recognition for their good work is entirely fair and deserved. I've also mentioned I think  Riot's lore teams don't always get the credit they deserve. My main problem is mostly the length of time it will take the comics to be released for free, but here's hoping they will be successful enough for the time it takes to decrease.

However, do not confuse 'fan commitment' to the possibility or pursuit of profit. I think Riot saw an opportunity to make money, and they went for it. As they said they, and by extension Marvel, have to make a profit. I just hope the lore teams' creativity and quality don't suffer because of Marvel's standard practices and the terms of their agreement with Riot (e.g. being pressed to create more stories in shorter time frames). But I have high hopes this will be successful and that all us lore fans will be satisfied with the quality we have come to expect. :D

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

I'm very sorry to hear that! As you mentioned, this has failed more times than anyone could ever count. Even Leagues lore team has been gutted once. In the history of gaming, outside in-game story content, I can't think of a single instance where this has succeeded. Make sure you keep your portfolio up to date and don't neglect any individual projects you may have going on, or that you have wanted to do.

Best wishes, that's a really tough position to be in!

Again we have high confidence in this.

When you read them you’ll see what we mean.

We believe, these aren’t just great video game comics.  These are great comics.

(Obviously I’m extremely biased and trying not to sound braggy. ;))
Actually forget I said anything. I’ll be patient and wait. :D

Firstly, thanks for the reply! 

I'm so glad to hear u will still be releasing free lore content! (that I can enjoy until the comics' free release :D) 

That said, here's hoping that u will be successful enough so that the release times/prices can go down; especially since I've always advocated for and tried to convince people (my friends who like league and even those who only like reading in the fantasy/sci-fi genre as a whole but who don't play video games) to read League's content.

I just hope (and what I'm afraid of) your deal with Marvel doesn't influence or change your storytelling and the quality thereof to suit their "preferences", "conditions" or "standard practices" regarding the manner in which stories are created and told. I would still like to see u guys follow your own creativity and do your own thing :)

I'll also be glad if u are rewarded for your good work (monetarily or through other means) since I've mentioned I think the lore teams don't always get the recognition they deserve.

Anyway, keep up the good work!
